Tidak baik memancing lawan dalam berdebat dengan kata yang tajam, karena hal demikian menimbulkan suasana yang panas. Sebaiknya dicipta-kan suasana nyaman dan santai sehingga tujuan dalam perdebatan untuk mencari kebenaran itu dapat tercapai dengan memuaskan.

Perdebatan yang baik ialah perdebatan yang dapat menghambat timbulnya sifat manusia yang negatif seperti sombong, tinggi hati, dan berusaha mempertahankan harga diri karena sifat-sifat tersebut sangat tercela. Lawan berdebat supaya dihadapi sedemikian rupa sehingga dia merasa bahwa harga dirinya dihormati, dan dai menunjukkan bahwa tujuan yang utama ialah menemukan kebenaran kepada agama Allah swt.

Kelima, akhir dari segala usaha dan perjuangan itu adalah iman kepada Allah swt, karena hanya Dialah yang menganugerahkan iman kepada jiwa manusia, bukan orang lain ataupun dai itu sendiri. Dialah Tuhan Yang Maha Mengetahui siapa di antara hamba-Nya yang tidak dapat mempertahankan fitrah insaniahnya (iman kepada Allah) dari pengaruh-pengaruh yang menyesatkan, hingga dia menjadi sesat, dan siapa pula di antara hamba yang fitrah insaniahnya tetap terpelihara sehingga dia terbuka menerima petunjuk (hidayah) Allah swt.
text.126:
Berdasarkan riwayat Abu Hurairah bahwa sesungguhnya Nabi saw berdiri di hadapan Hamzah ketika terbunuh sebagai syahid dalam Perang Uhud. Tidak ada pemandangan yang paling menyakitkan hati Nabi daripada melihat jenazah Hamzah yang dicincang (mutilasi). Lalu Nabi bersabda, "Semoga Allah mencurahkan rahmat kepadamu. Sesungguhnya engkau”sepengetahuanku”adalah orang yang senang silaturrahim dan banyak berbuat kebaikan. Kalau bukan karena kesedihan berpisah denganmu, sungguh aku lebih senang bersamamu sampai di Padang Mahsyar bersama para arwah. Demi Allah, aku akan membalas dengan balasan yang setimpal tujuh puluh orang dari mereka sebagai penggantimu." Maka Jibril turun dengan membawa ayat-ayat di akhir Surah an-Nahl, "Dan jika kamu membalas, maka balaslah dengan (balasan) yang sama dengan siksaan yang ditimpakan kepadamu. Tetapi jika kamu bersabar, sesungguhnya itulah yang lebih baik bagi orang yang sabar." Pada saat itu Rasulullah berdiri di hadapan jenazah Hamzah.

Dalam ayat ini Allah swt menegaskan kepada kaum Muslimin, yang akan mewarisi perjuangan Nabi Muhammad dalam menyebarkan agama Islam, untuk menjadikan sikap Rasul di atas sebagai pegangan mereka dalam menghadapi lawan.

Pedoman dakwah yang diberikan Allah pada ayat yang lalu, adalah pedoman dalam medan dakwah dengan lisan, hujjah lawan hujjah. Dakwah berjalan dalam suasana damai. Akan tetapi, jika dakwah mendapat perlawanan yang kasar, misalnya para dai disiksa atau dibunuh, Islam menetapkan sikap tegas untuk menghadapi keadaan demikian dengan tetap menjunjung tinggi kebenaran. Dua macam jalan yang diterangkan Allah dalam ayat ini, pertama: membalas dengan balasan yang seimbang. Kedua: menerima tindakan permusuhan itu dengan hati yang sabar dan memaafkan kesalahan itu jika bisa memberi pengaruh yang lebih baik bagi jalannya dakwah.

Menurut Ibnu Katsir, ayat ini mempunyai makna dan tujuan yang sama dengan beberapa ayat dalam Al-Qur'an yaitu mengandung keharusan adil dan dorongan berbuat keutamaan, seperti firman Allah:

Dan balasan suatu kejahatan adalah kejahatan yang setimpal, tetapi barang siapa memaafkan dan berbuat baik (kepada orang yang berbuat jahat) maka pahalanya dari Allah. Sungguh, Dia tidak menyukai orang-orang zalim. (asy-Syura/42: 40)

Firman Allah swt:

¦Dan luka-luka (pun) ada qisasnya (balasan yang sama). Barang siapa melepaskan (hak qisas)nya, maka itu (menjadi) penebus dosa baginya. (al-Ma'idah/5: 45)
text.127:
Allah mempertegas lagi perintah-Nya kepada Rasul agar bersifat sabar dan tabah dalam menghadapi gangguan orang kafir Quraisy dan hambatan mereka terhadap dakwahnya. Namun Allah menyatakan kepada Nabi bahwa kesabaran itu terwujud dalam batin disebabkan Allah memberikan pertolongan dan taufik kepadanya. Kesabaran merupakan daya perlawanan terhadap gejala emosi manusia dan perlawanan terhadap nafsu yang bergejolak. Itulah hidayah Allah yang diberikan kepada hamba-Nya yang dikehendaki.

Pernyataan Allah ini membesarkan hati Nabi saw, kesulitan-kesulitan menjadi terasa ringan berkat anugerah Allah. Rasul saw tidak perlu merasa risau, cemas dan bersedih hati terhadap sikap lawannya yang menjauh dari seruannya, atau sikap permusuhan mereka yang mendustakan dan mengingkari wahyu yang diturunkan kepada-Nya. Apalagi jika Rasul saw merasa kecil hati dan putus asa terhadap keingkaran yang mereka lakukan, seperti beliau dituduh penyihir, dukun, penyair dan sebagainya, hal demikian lebih tidak dibenarkan oleh Allah. Sebenarnya segala tuduhan itu bermaksud menghalangi orang lain untuk beriman kepada Rasul saw. Dalam ayat yang lain Allah melarang Nabi berkecil hati terhadap gangguan orang kafir. Firman-Nya:

(Inilah) Kitab yang diturunkan kepadamu (Muhammad) maka janganlah engkau sesak dada karenanya, agar engkau memberi peringatan dengan (Kitab) itu dan menjadi pelajaran bagi orang yang beriman. (al-A'raf/7: 2)

Meskipun pelajaran-pelajaran di atas ditujukan kepada Nabi saw, namun berlaku bagi para pengikutnya.
text.128:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah swt menjelaskan alasan mengapa Nabi diperintahkan bersabar dan dilarang untuk cemas dan berkecil hati. Allah swt menegaskan bahwa Dia selalu ada bersama orang yang bertakwa dan orang yang berbuat kebaikan sebagai penolong mereka. Allah selalu memenuhi permintaan mereka, memperkuat, dan memenangkan mereka melawan orang-orang kafir.

Orang-orang yang takwa selalu bersama Allah swt karena mereka terus menyucikan diri untuk mendekatkan diri kepada-Nya dan melenyapkan kemasygulan yang ada pada jiwa mereka. Mereka tidak pernah merasa kecewa jika kehilangan kesempatan, tetapi juga tidak merasa senang bila memperoleh kesempatan. Demikian pula Allah selalu menyertai orang yang berbuat kebaikan, melaksanakan kewajiban mereka kepada-Nya, dan selalu menaati perintah dan menjauhi larangan-Nya. Pernyataan Allah kepada mereka yang takwa dan berbuat ihsan (kebaikan) dalam ayat ini mempunyai pengertian yang sama dengan pernyataan Allah dalam firman-Nya kepada Nabi Musa dan Harun a.s.:

Dia (Allah) berfirman, "Janganlah kamu berdua khawatir, sesungguhnya Aku bersama kamu berdua, Aku mendengar dan melihat. (thaha/20: 46)

Juga mempunyai pengertian yang sama dengan firman Allah kepada malaikat:

(Ingatlah), ketika Tuhanmu mewahyukan kepada para malaikat, "Sesungguhnya Aku bersama kamu, maka teguhkanlah (pendirian) orang-orang yang telah beriman." (al-Anfal/8: 12)

en.name: The Bee
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
Allah affirms that Allah's decree will surely come to pass. The meaning of Allah's decree in this verse is the Day of Judgment, which has been threatened to the polytheists and disbelievers. They mockingly asked the Prophet to hasten the punishment of the Day of Judgment. That is why Allah commanded Prophet Muhammad to say that Allah's punishment, which will be inflicted upon them, will certainly occur. Allah swt forbids them from asking for the punishment to be hastened, because the punishment of the Day of Judgment will come at a time that has been determined and decided by Him.

In this verse, Allah swt announces the coming of the Day of Judgment using the past tense verb (fi'il madhi), even though the punishment has not yet occurred. This gives the understanding that the punishment will absolutely happen. This verse contains a threat to the disbelievers and at the same time contains a notification to them that the punishment that will be inflicted upon them and their destruction is near and certain to come.

Allah swt declares that He is glorified and exalted above what they associate with Him. He does not need partners or helpers to inflict punishment upon them. This refutation is a response to their statement that they will seek help (syafa'at) from the idols they worship.
text.2:
After that verse was revealed, the Quraysh asked, "If Allah is indeed powerful to punish His other servants, then who knows this very unseen thing that no one knows except Him?" This question only shows their denial of the occurrence of the Day of Judgment. Therefore, Allah commanded the Prophet Muhammad to say that the news was known from the revelation that Allah sent down through the angels. It is from this revelation that unseen news can be known. The revelation is brought by the angels with Allah's command to His servant whom He wills. This explanation is put forward so that they can know that someone who receives revelation means that he has received the task of prophethood. What is meant by *ruh* (spirit) in this verse is revelation, as is clear from its meaning in another verse:

"He sends down the angels with the revelation by His command upon whom He wills of His servants..." (al-Mu'min/40: 15)

And His word again:

"And thus We have revealed to you (Muhammad) a *ruh* (i.e., the Qur'an) of Our command..." (ash-Shura/42: 52)

The revelation is brought by the angels to the prophets solely because of Allah's command and not the will of the angels themselves. As affirmed in other verses as follows:

"And we (Jibril) do not descend except by the command of your Lord." (Maryam/19: 64)

And the word of Allah swt:

"They do not precede Him in speech, and they act by His command." (al-Anbiya'/21: 27)

The revelation is given by Allah to His chosen servants who have the mental readiness to receive it. Its purpose is as a means to give warning to the servants of Allah. Among other things, to convey the teachings of *tawhid* and convince them of the oneness of Allah, that there is no god worthy of worship except Allah and He is the Lord of all creatures, while other gods are gods of their creation that are far from the truth. Thus, it is obligatory for humans to devote themselves solely to Him because in this way humans will be saved from destruction and freed from error. In that verse, there is a guidance that the revelation descends from Allah to His prophet through the mediation of the angels. In another verse it is mentioned:

"All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers..." (al-Baqarah/2: 285)

The angels are mentioned before the messengers to state that the angels receive revelation from Allah without intermediaries. While what is meant by the books are the revelations conveyed by the angels to His prophets.

At the end of this verse, Allah swt affirms that humans should only be mindful of Him. This is a call addressed to those who believe to remain mindful of Him. It is also addressed to the disbelieving Quraysh who oppose the occurrence of the Day of Judgment so that they stop their polytheism and abandon the traits that oppose the provisions that come from Allah due to the haste in rejecting something whose truth has not been believed.
text.3:
Allah SWT explains that He created the things in the heavens and the things on earth with truth (haq). This means in accordance with His wisdom and knowledge, and nothing is in vain. He created everything without the help or assistance of anyone. He simply created the objects and the laws that apply to them, so that the objects function according to their laws. There is no other entity that has the power to create, regulate, and control the heavens, the earth, and all their contents. Consequently, it is not appropriate for anyone to enslave themselves to gods other than Him. Therefore, Allah states at the end of this verse that He is Exalted above what they associate with Him. (Further explanation can be seen in the tafsir of Surah Ibrahim/14:19).

The creation of the heavens and the earth with haq (truth) can also mean that God did not create the earth playfully. Everything is so precise for the beginning of life on this earth. We can see how comfortable the earth is compared to some other planets in the same solar system in the description below. In the comparison made, especially on the distance between the sun and each planet, the effect of distance on each planet is apparent.

What is written above is only a part of the "design decisions" made by Allah so that life on earth can exist and survive. But even this little is enough to show that the existence of the earth is not accidental. Nor is it formed by a series of random events.

This and countless other details reaffirm the simple and pure truth. Allah and only Allah created the universe, stars, planets, mountains, and seas perfectly, giving life to humans and other living beings, and placing His creation under human control. Allah and only Allah, the source of forgiveness and power, is powerful enough to create something from nothing.
text.4:
Then in this verse, Allah explains the process of human creation, that He created him from *nuthfah* (semen). In another verse, it is explained that Allah created man from a weak fluid. This creation goes through a process of development. In the womb, semen transforms into *'alaqah* (something clinging to the wall of the uterus), then into a lump of flesh. After a period of 4 months, a perfect fetus begins to take shape, and after 9 months of gestation, the baby is delivered from its mother's womb into the world. After that, the baby still needs the help and care of its mother to be breastfed, cared for, and educated until adulthood and can think perfectly.

Humans who undergo a complex and gradual process of creation, from a weak creature to a mighty one, suddenly deny the oneness of their Creator and the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection, and become enemies of the Messengers of Allah, even though they were created only as servants. Humans even forget the origin of their creation, that they were created from a drop of water that has no ability whatsoever. They say frankly, as explained in Allah's word:

"And they would say, "There is not but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected." (al-An'am/6: 29)

They also deny the resurrection of humans after death and becoming bones. Allah's word:

"He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?" (Yasin/36: 78)
text.5: In this verse, Allah swt explains the variety of blessings provided for His servants in the form of livestock, such as camels, cows, goats, and so on. The benefits obtained from these animals include their wool, which can be made into woolen cloth, useful for protecting the body from the cold air, and their hides, which can be made into shoes and other equipment. Likewise, their milk and meat are beneficial for human health. In short, it can be said that livestock are created for humans so that they can be utilized as a source of fulfilling their life's needs.
text.6: Allah swt explains that humans obtain inner satisfaction and beautiful sights from livestock when they release and drive them out in the morning to the grazing grounds. The same feeling is also felt in the afternoon when they drive and herd the livestock back to their pens. The beauty that humans obtain from livestock is included in the blessings of Allah bestowed upon His servants.
text.7:
Then Allah mentions another of His blessings that humans obtain from livestock, namely transporting goods or heavy burdens for humans from one place to another, which they are unable to carry themselves.

Allah says:

And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat. (al-Mu'minun/23: 21)

And His saying:

It is Allah who made for you the grazing livestock so you may ride some of them, and from some of them you eat. (al-Mu'min/40: 79)

Then Allah SWT affirms that He is the Most Compassionate and Most Merciful. Allah's compassion is mentioned in this verse so that humans can be grateful for the blessings of Allah that they obtain from livestock, which are very beneficial to them as a means of transportation that is very important for their lives.

Allah SWT says:

Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners? (Yasin/36: 71)
text.8:
Furthermore, Allah SWT mentions several other livestock that are beneficial to human life, namely Allah created horses, mules, and donkeys to be ridden and used as pleasant domestic animals.

There is a group of jurists (ahli fikih) who prohibit horse meat. They argue that horses were created by Allah to be used as vehicles, not to be eaten. This argument is reinforced by the text of the verse mentioning three types of livestock. This indicates that horses, donkeys, and mules are all equally forbidden to be eaten. If these three animals were permissible to eat, they would have been mentioned in this verse, because a person's need for food is more pressing than their need for transportation.

However, the above argument is not agreed upon by other jurists on the grounds that if this verse indicated the prohibition of horses, then domesticated donkeys would be included. If that were the case, there would have been no need to explicitly prohibit eating domesticated donkeys during the Battle of Khaybar, because the verse was revealed long before the Battle of Khaybar.

In addition, there are many evidences that permit eating horse meat, including:

From Asma' r.a., "We sacrificed a horse during the time of the Messenger of Allah, and then we ate its meat." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

From Jabir r.a., "The Messenger of Allah ordered us to eat horse meat and forbade us from eating the meat of domesticated donkeys." (Narrated by Abu 'Ubaid, Ibn Abi Shaybah, at-Tirmizi, an-Nasa'i, and others)

From Jabir r.a., "The Messenger of Allah forbade eating the meat of domesticated donkeys and permitted eating horse meat." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Abu Dawud)

In addition to these hadiths, there is indeed a hadith that prohibits eating the meat of horses, mules, and donkeys.

The Messenger of Allah forbade eating the meat of every wild animal with fangs, the meat of mules, and domesticated donkeys. (Narrated by Ahmad)

The hadith that prohibits horse meat is *daif* (weak) because the name Salah bin Yahya, whose memory is doubted, is mentioned in its chain of narrators (sanad). Even if this hadith is considered *sahih* (authentic), its strength does not exceed the strength of other *sahih* hadiths, which are more numerous, that permit eating horse meat.

In short, it can be said that the hadith that prohibits eating the meat of horses, mules, and donkeys occurred before the event of the Battle of Khaybar. Therefore, it can be said that this hadith was *naskh* (abrogated) by the hadith that clarifies its permissibility.

At the end of the verse, Allah mentions that He created all creatures that are not yet known to humans, whether land, sea, or air animals, from which they can benefit. However, until now, the human mind has not yet reached the knowledge of the benefits of these creatures. All of this is so that humans can understand how vast Allah SWT's blessings are that are given to them without ceasing.
text.9:
Allah swt mentions His blessings that are beneficial for the interests of the human soul, so that they may know and be grateful to the Creator of the universe and this vast blessing. Allah explains that He has the highest authority to guide mankind through revelation to His messengers and commands them to obey Him. This is so that people may arrive at the truth. Thus, whoever follows that guidance will obtain happiness that is very beneficial for themselves. However, whoever takes the path of error, the consequences will be suffered and felt by themselves.

Allah swt says:

And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way. This has He instructed you that you may become righteous. (al-An'am/6: 153)

And His saying:

[Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me that is straight." (al-Hijr/15: 41)

And His saying:

Indeed, [it is] upon Us to provide guidance. (al-Lail/92: 12)

Besides the straight path, there is a path that deviates from the truth. If people go through that path, they will not achieve happiness. That path is the path of error, which leads people to division and destruction.

According to this verse, the straight path that leads people to obtain happiness is only the religion of Islam, which is the *hanif* religion, prescribed by Allah and revealed to the Prophet Muhammad saw, and in accordance with human *fitrah*.

Allah swt says:

So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the *fitrah* of Allah upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of Allah. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know. (ar-Rum/30: 30)

Indeed, Allah is able to guide all people to adhere to the religion of *tauhid*. However, Allah swt is All-Wise. He gives people the right to choose because they have reason and intellect to be used as they should. Allah also provides guidance through revelation to mankind through His messengers, so that they may carry out that guidance based on their choice. Allah says:

And if your Lord had willed, those on earth would have believed - all of them entirely. (Yunus/10: 99)

To encourage people to do good deeds, Allah swt promises rewards. As an effort to eliminate their tendency to do bad deeds, Allah also gives warnings with painful threats. This is intended so that people will follow His guidance and avoid His prohibitions.
text.10:
Allah mentions the blessings that humans obtain from the sky, directly or indirectly. Allah's blessings that they obtain directly are rainwater, which can be used as drinking water and for other necessities in their daily lives, such as bathing, washing clothes, and so on. The descent of rainwater also makes the hot air cool and refreshes the body.

Meanwhile, Allah's blessings that are obtained indirectly from rainwater are that the water can irrigate rice fields and revive all kinds of plants. All these plants are very beneficial for humans and other creatures, such as humans being able to graze their livestock in pastures.

This verse is one of many verses that speak about rain and the fertility that results from it. For details regarding rain, see Surah an-Nur/24: 43 and ar-Rum/30: 48-49. Meanwhile, a description of how rain plays a very important role in fertility can be seen in Surah Qaf/50: 9-11.
text.11:
Through that rain as well, Allah SWT grows plants whose fruits can fulfill the needs of human life. From various types of grasses, humans obtain food for their livestock; from olives, they obtain oil needed by the body; and from dates and grapes, they can obtain fruits as nutritional supplements to their food.

Then, all kinds of fruits are also mentioned, so that humans can know His limitless power. From the same water, Allah SWT has the power to grow diverse plants and produce fruits of diverse shapes, colors, and tastes. All kinds of plants that produce materials that can fulfill their needs are a blessing given by Allah and at the same time, proof of His oneness for those who deny Him.

At the end of this verse, it is explained that all kinds of blessings that are sent down, whether directly or indirectly, are proof of the truth that there is indeed no god but Allah. These proofs can be known by those who pay attention to and contemplate the signs of Allah's power, as well as contemplate the laws that apply within them.

The proofs of Allah's power found in nature are sufficient to provide satisfaction to those who truly pay attention to His power and believe in His oneness. For example, observe the seeds, whether single-seeded or dicotyledonous, that lie on the surface of the soil moistened by rainwater. Over time, the seed cracks open and its roots emerge, penetrating the surface of the soil. Then, stems and leaves grow, and then develop into large plants, flowering and bearing fruit.

One thing that attracts attention is that seeds that are almost identical in shape produce diverse plants and produce fruits of various shapes, colors, and tastes. Those who witness this will certainly see that the creator of all kinds of plants must be the Most Perfect Being who cannot be rivaled by other beings. He is the One who deserves to be Lord and worshiped.
text.12:
Allah SWT explains that He is the One who controls the night and day, as well as the sun and the moon. All of this is for the benefit of mankind and as a blessing created by Allah for them. Allah controls the day and night in alternating succession. The night is a time for rest and sleep so that the mind is calm during the day. While the day is a time to strive to seek sustenance to fulfill the needs of life.

Allah mentions the sun and the moon. The sun is the cause of day and night. When the sun appears on the horizon in the eastern part of the sky, it means the day has begun. Gradually the sun rises higher, moving slowly in the sky, and when it has set on the western horizon, it means night has arrived. The sun as a source of energy is very necessary for all living things on the surface of the earth, such as humans, animals, and plants.

The moon moves faster than the sun; at one point it is crescent-shaped, a few days later it grows larger, and finally becomes a full moon. After that, its light begins to diminish and its shape returns to a crescent shape, and finally disappears completely. From these various changes in the shape of the moon, people can know the calendar which is very useful for carrying out worship. In short, it can be said that the celestial bodies are a great blessing from Allah for mankind, and beneficial for their lives or knowledge.

Allah SWT mentions that He controls the stars that move in their own orbits according to the laws that He has established. Their movements are so regular and constant, as is their position. This provides guidance to humans to know their position on earth by using the position of the stars as a guide, whether on land, at sea, or in the air, especially when other signs and identification markers cannot be seen.

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT emphasizes once again that the sun, moon, and stars are clear signs for those who want to think about the signs of Allah's power and can understand the laws that apply in this universe. This implies that thinking about the signs of Allah's power that are in the sky is not obtained by a fleeting glance, but by contemplating and thinking with a sound mind. This is because of the very great distance of these objects from the earth, so that humans cannot see them with the naked eye. This is different from observing the signs of Allah's power that are on the surface of the earth. In this case, with a fleeting glance at the signs of Allah's power that are within their reach, humans will be able to know the greatness of their Creator.
text.13:
Allah explains that He also controls all kinds of things He created, whether those things are only found on the surface of the earth, such as various kinds of livestock and plants, or things found in the bowels of the earth, such as minerals and mining products. All of these were created by Allah in diverse types, forms, and benefits.

At the end of the verse, it is explained that indeed in the blessings that Allah has created in various forms, there are signs of Allah's power for those who take lessons. That is, for those who understand how great the blessings of Allah are that have been given to them and are grateful by utilizing them properly and according to their needs in accordance with Allah's pleasure.
text.14:
Furthermore, Allah swt mentions the blessings found in the seas that He has bestowed upon His servants. It is explained that He is the One who has subjected the seas for mankind. This means subjecting all kinds of His blessings found in the seas so that humans can obtain food from the sea in the form of fresh meat, namely all kinds of fish that humans obtain by catching them.

The comparison of fish to fresh meat is to be understood that what is permissible to eat from all types of fish found in the sea is that which is caught in a fresh state, even if the animal dies without being slaughtered. However, if all types of fish obtained are not fresh, are dead, let alone rotten, then it is not permissible to eat them because it is feared that they will endanger health. What is meant by animals that die in the sea are animals that die on their own or due to other causes, so that they float on the surface of the water, not those that die because they are caught by humans.

The Messenger of Allah said:

"Eat all sea animals that die from lack of water, and eat all sea animals that are stranded on land from the sea, but do not eat animals that float in the sea." (Dhaif hadith narrated by Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah from Jabir)

Fish that die in the sea are permissible to eat because the Prophet Muhammad saw said:

"The sea is pure its water and lawful its carrion." (Narrated by the Four Imams from Abu Hurairah)

It should be understood once again that the carrion of sea animals that is permissible to eat is animals that are caught by humans, that are thrown onto land, that die from lack of water, and that are still fresh, not animals that die floating in the sea and are already rotten.

Furthermore, Allah swt mentions another blessing that humans can obtain from the sea, namely in the form of jewelry. Among them are pearls and coral.

Pearls are jewelry obtained from inside the body of a type of shellfish, the process of which begins with the entry of a kind of hard object, sand, or other foreign object into the body of the shellfish. Because it is very disturbing to its bodily organs, the shellfish secretes a kind of liquid that can harden to wrap the hard object. This process continues continuously so that over time a kind of round and shiny object is formed, its color is bluish-white, reddish, or yellowish, which is very beautiful to look at. This object is removed by humans from the shellfish, some are small and some are large according to the length of time the object is in the body of the shellfish. That is what is meant by pearls.

Another jewelry is coral, a kind of plant that lives on the seabed and is similar to coral. Coral is taken by humans from the sea and made into necklaces, bracelets, or other jewelry that is very beautiful. All of these are Allah's blessings given to humans that are priceless.

Another blessing given to humans from the sea is that they can make it a means of transportation for shipping, both by sailing ships and motor ships. The ships go back and forth from one country to another to transport all kinds of trade goods, thus facilitating trade between these countries. From this trade, humans get sustenance because of the profits they earn.

These blessings of Allah are mentioned so that humans are grateful for all the blessings that He has given them. It is also intended that humans can understand how great Allah's blessings are that have been given to them and utilize these unparalleled blessings to worship Him and for their own welfare.
text.15:
Allah swt also mentions the blessings that humans receive indirectly. He created mountains on the earth so that the earth would not shake. Thus, animals and humans on its surface can live peacefully. The image that can be taken from this verse is that mountains were created by Allah as maintainers of the earth's balance so that it can rotate peacefully. The tranquility of the earth due to the presence of mountains can be likened to the tranquility of a boat on the water. If the boat is not given a load, it is easily shaken by the waves. But if given a sufficiently heavy load, the boat is not easily swayed.

Allah swt created rivers on the surface of the earth that flow from one place to another as a blessing given to His servants. The river functions as a source of irrigation that can be regulated to irrigate rice fields and fields, so that humans can cultivate to meet all kinds of needs. In addition, rivers can also be used as a means of transportation for the purpose of transporting human merchandise.

Allah also created land that can be used as a means of communication and transportation from one country to another. The roads stretch from the coast, through forests, and circle mountains, so that humans can reach their goals without getting lost to other places. That is why at the end of this verse, Allah swt mentions that the benefit of these roads is so that humans get guidance. Meaning, not getting lost without a direction.

The word of Allah:

And We have placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein broad passes [roads] so that they may be guided. (al-Anbiya'/21: 31)

Verse 15 of Surah an-Nahl/16 also implies how the geological process works, which is basically a never-ending cycle. When the erosion process occurs, all the eroded material is spread and deposited in lower places, even reaching the lowest areas such as the trenches located west of the island of Sumatra or south of the island of Java. The accumulation of material due to erosion for millions of years is simultaneously compressed by plates that continue to move and gradually produce mountains.

The geological process always leads to a measured equilibrium. In towering mountains, this load presses the earth's crust beneath it and causes the earth's crust to bend deeper, like a root that penetrates deeply and makes the earth stable. So, under the mountains there is a root whose thickness is proportional to its weight (measured). An example of this phenomenon is that under the towering Himalayas there is a deep root.
text.16:
In addition to that, Allah SWT created mountains as signs that humans can use as guides to know where they are. When someone sails on the ocean and can still see landmarks on land, the mountains serve as signs for them to determine the position and location of their boat.

Furthermore, Allah SWT also explains that He created stars that can also be used as directional indicators. Stars are used by travelers on land, sailors, and aviators as guides at night when landmarks can no longer be used. Because at night it is dark, only the light of the stars is the clearest for them. Humans can take guidance from the stars by recognizing constellations that have been given individual names in astronomy. Of course, those who can use stars as guides are those who have been able to distinguish each constellation and know its rising and setting times. These constellations are used as guidelines in determining their position on the surface of the earth.
text.17:
After that, Allah swt silenced the polytheists and refuted the arguments they put forward because they refused to pay attention to the signs of Allah's power and remained immersed in their polytheism. Allah swt commanded them to consider whether the One who created all kinds of blessings given to mankind is the same as the idols they worship, which cannot create anything. Why do they not learn from the various blessings so that they will recognize who truly deserves to possess the highest authority and determine all kinds of events according to His will?

Indeed, if they were to reflect on the events of nature and all its contents, and all the blessings they receive, they would certainly abandon the worship of idols, which has become the tradition of their ancestors.
text.18:
Allah then affirms that if humans were to try to count His blessings, they would certainly be unable to determine their number, because human minds are very limited, while Allah's blessings are so vast. Therefore, the obligation of humans is only to be grateful for these blessings and to utilize them to fulfill their life's needs and to serve society in accordance with Allah's guidance and pleasure (rida).

At the end of the verse, it is emphasized that indeed Allah is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful. Forgiveness is mentioned in this verse because most humans are grateful for only a small portion of the blessings they receive, while they forget the very vast blessings altogether. The mention of the words Most Merciful indicates that Allah will not immediately punish them for their denial of Allah's vast blessings.
text.19:
Allah swt explains that He is All-Knowing of everything that humans conceal. This means that Allah knows what is in the hearts of people, which is different from what they say and do.

Even though people keep secret in their hearts what is actually happening and no one can know it, later on the Day of Judgment that secret will be revealed by Allah to everyone. Allah will reward those who do good according to their good deeds, and punish those who do evil according to their evil deeds. Allah Himself will ask them whether they are grateful or even deny the blessings that He has given them.
text.20:
After that, Allah SWT explained to the polytheists the true state of the idols. This serves as a reaffirmation of their ignorance in not being able to assess the true state of the idols they worship.

Allah SWT states that those who worship gods other than Allah mean they are worshiping something that cannot create anything. What they worship is only a creature created by Allah. So, the idols and other objects of worship cannot have any influence because they are only the result of human carvings themselves.

Allah SWT says:

"He (Abraham) said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve, While Allah created you and that which you do?" (as-Saffat/37: 95-96)

This question is an expression of the feelings of Prophet Ibrahim when he saw his people worshiping idols. This shows the truth of Prophet Ibrahim's statement because the idols are merely human creations.
text.21:
Allah swt then explained that idols are inanimate objects. These idols cannot think about how they should grant the prayers that are requested of them. Allah swt affirmed that these statues are not living things that can exert influence, either on themselves or outside of themselves. These idols, whether worshipped or not, will not provide any benefit whatsoever and will not cause any harm either.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that these idols will not know or feel when their worshippers are resurrected in the future. Only Allah, the creator of the universe and its contents, knows this, while the statues will not know anything because they are merely inanimate objects.
text.22:
Allah swt explains that the God who must be worshipped and obeyed by all mankind is the One and Only God. This affirmation of the One and Only, provides the understanding that only He is worthy of worship. Therefore, He alone must be obeyed by all mankind, and no other gods should be elevated as partners to Him.

Following this, this verse explains that the disbelievers associate partners with Allah because they refuse to acknowledge the Oneness of Allah, His promises and threats, and the occurrence of the Day of Judgment. That is why they disobey everything conveyed by the Prophet Muhammad saw, even though the news conveyed contains information about the power and truth of Allah and the vastness of the blessings bestowed upon mankind. Their hearts have been sealed, even though they have been informed that their worship is incorrect. The One who deserves to be worshipped is Allah, the One and Only, yet they still refuse to believe.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that they are arrogant people who refuse to accept the truth. They refuse to submit to the truth, continue to deny it, and blindly follow their ancestors.

Allah swt says:

*Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a most astonishing thing.* (Shad/38: 5)

*And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [they worship] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.* (az-Zumar/39: 45)

*Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are guided by their traces." And similarly, We did not send before you [Muhammad] any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are following in their footsteps."* (az-Zukhruf/43: 22-23)

(23) Undoubtedly, Allah knows the denial of the polytheists towards the revelation that has been given to the Prophet Muhammad saw, which they conceal in their hearts. Allah also knows what they say about the Prophet Muhammad saw and their accusations that he fabricates false news.

At the end of the verse, it is explained that Allah does not like arrogant people who refuse to believe in His Oneness and are reluctant to follow the call of His prophets and messengers. This statement shows how angry and hateful Allah is towards them and their attitude of not understanding their own position. In another verse, Allah swt threatens that the arrogant will be thrown into Hell. Allah swt says:

*Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell in humiliation.* (al-Mu'min/40: 60)

Rasulullah saw said:

"He will not enter Paradise who has an atom's weight of arrogance in his heart, and he will not enter Hell who has an atom's weight of faith in his heart." Then a man said, "O Messenger of Allah, what if a man likes his clothes to be good and his sandals to be good?" Then the Messenger of Allah replied, "Indeed, Allah is beautiful and loves beauty. Arrogance is rejecting the truth and looking down on people." (Narrated by Muslim, Abu Dawud, at-Tirmidzi, and Ibn Majah, from Ibn Mas'ud)
text.23:
Allah SWT explains that the God who must be worshipped and obeyed by all mankind is the One and Only God. The affirmation with the One and Only, gives the understanding that only He is worthy of worship. Therefore, He alone must be obeyed by all mankind and they must not elevate other gods as His partners.

After that, in this verse it is explained that the disbelievers associate partners with Allah with other gods because they do not want to acknowledge the Oneness of Allah, His promises and threats, and the occurrence of the Day of Judgment. That is why they rebel against whatever is conveyed by the Prophet Muhammad SAW, even though the news conveyed contains news about the power and truth of Allah and the vastness of the blessings given to mankind. Their hearts have been closed, even though it has been proclaimed to them that their worship is not correct. The One who has the right to be worshipped should be Allah the One and Only, yet they still do not want to believe.

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT affirms that they are arrogant people who do not want to accept the truth. They do not want to submit to the truth, continue to deny it, and blindly follow their ancestors.

Allah SWT says:

"Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a most astonishing thing." (Shad/38: 5)

"And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [they worship] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice." (az-Zumar/39: 45)

"Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are guided by their traces." And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are followers of their footsteps." (az-Zukhruf/43: 22-23)
text.24:
Allah SWT explains the arrogance of the polytheists, which is that when they are asked what Allah has revealed, they answer that Allah has not revealed anything to Muhammad. What Muhammad recites is nothing but the fables of the ancients that he takes from ancient books.

Such utterances illustrate their arrogance towards the Messenger of Allah and towards the word of Allah.

Allah SWT says:

"And they say, "(These are only) legends of the former peoples, which he has written down, and they are recited to him morning and afternoon." (al-Furqan/25: 5)

Their arrogance towards the Prophet Muhammad is depicted in words such as their accusations that the Prophet Muhammad was a magician, a poet, and a soothsayer. Some even excessively accused him of being insane. Their arrogance towards the Prophet Muhammad SAW is not only evident in their words but has truly permeated their souls and flesh.

Allah SWT says:

"Indeed, he thought and plotted - So may he be killed! How he plotted! Then he looked - Then he frowned and scowled - Then he turned away and was arrogant - And said, "This is not but magic learned [from others]. This is not but the word of a human being." (al-Muddatstsir/74: 18-25)
text.25:
Allah SWT explains that their arrogant words cause them to bear their own sins and the sins of those who blindly follow those words. Those who follow are equated in law with those who are followed because each of them has been given reason to judge the words of those who are followed. However, they do not use that reason, so they follow without any basis. As for those who are followed, in addition to bearing their own sins, they also bear the sins of those who are misled. They are considered as misleaders and the cause of others believing as they believe. The Prophet Muhammad SAW said:

"Whoever invites people to guidance (the religion of Islam), he will receive the reward of those who follow him, and that will not reduce their rewards in the slightest. And whoever invites to misguidance, he will receive sins like the sins of those who follow, which will not reduce their sins in the slightest." (Narrated by Ahmad and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

And Allah's word:

"And they will surely bear their own burdens, and burdens [added] to their own burdens. And they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent." (al-'Ankabut/29: 13)

They are threatened with a severe threat because they judge Allah's words conveyed to the Messenger with an unreasonable judgment. They have polluted their own minds and souls so that they dare to commit various kinds of deceptions to bring down the personality of the Messenger in front of his followers. They are given a severe threat because of the sinful deeds they have committed. They even bear the sins of those who follow them on the Day of Judgment. Then Allah states that the sin they bear is the heaviest sin.
text.26:
Allah explains that the deception of the polytheists will only harm themselves. They will experience suffering like that felt by previous peoples who also denied their messengers with various kinds of deception and various kinds of excuses. An example is what Pharaoh did when he asked his minister to build a tall tower in order to see the God of Moses (peace be upon him).

Allah's word:

And Pharaoh said, "O Haman, construct for me a tower that I may reach the roads - The roads into the heavens - and look at the God of Moses; and indeed, I do think he is a liar." And thus was made pleasing to Pharaoh his evil deed, and he was averted from the [right] way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin. (al-Mu'min/40: 36-37)

Then Allah swt depicts that the deception they committed against the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is like people building a house. After the house is finished, Allah destroys the house from its foundations. After the foundation is destroyed and the pillars begin to fall, the roof and the entire building collapse, so that it befalls themselves. They themselves did not feel beforehand what would happen and what consequences they would have to accept for the actions they had done.

The consequence of their actions not only destroys themselves, but also destroys their families and descendants. This is an accurate picture of how Allah swt thwarted their deception.

Then Allah swt explains that they will receive punishment at a time they do not expect and are not aware of. This shows that the consequences they encounter are not as they had previously thought. What happened to previous peoples also applies to Muslims, where they thought that with various kinds of deception, they could hinder and destroy Islamic da'wah. But on the contrary, Islamic da'wah is increasingly widespread and the spirit of its followers is increasingly strengthened. Finally, they will experience destruction in various battlefields, especially during the Battle of Badr.
text.27:
The aforementioned calamity is a worldly punishment for them, while in the Hereafter, Allah SWT will inflict a severe torment upon them, and they will experience unparalleled humiliation. Their humiliation is depicted by their state of confusion, searching for their former allies who once invited them to engage in deception. They regret that those who once invited them can no longer provide support to free them from Allah's punishment. For at that time, humans have no power, nor is there anyone who can provide assistance.

Allah's word:

"Then man will have no power, nor any helper." (ath-Thariq/86: 10)

Then Allah SWT explains that on the Day of Resurrection, those who have been given knowledge, namely those who know and follow the guidance of revelation and are certain of the truth of the guidance they received, and believe in the Oneness of Allah and the prophethood of Muhammad, will smile with satisfaction. They say that humiliation and torment on that day are truly inflicted upon the disbelievers as a result of denying Allah, opposing His messengers, and denying the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection.

Allah's word:

"So today those who have believed are laughing at the disbelievers, on adorned couches, observing." (al-Muthaffifin/83: 34-35)
text.28:
Then, Allah SWT depicts the state of the polytheists at the end of their lives, which is when the angel of death is about to seize their souls while they are still in a state of wronging themselves. They cannot escape death and the angel of death, even though they have denied the Creator of the universe.

At that moment, they imagine the torment they will receive for denying Allah the One and only and wronging themselves. At that time, their conscience speaks, and they acknowledge His truth, saying, "We did not associate anything with Allah." As Allah says:

"By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who associated [anything with Him]." (al-An'am/6: 23)

Such an admission is too late because before death, they denied the oneness of Allah and wallowed in falsehood in the world. It is not right for them to expect happiness, because they have been given reason that can judge good and bad. They are aware of how great the sin is of denying the oneness of Allah and the revelation received by the Prophet Muhammad SAW. Therefore, the appropriate punishment for them is to receive torment that is in accordance with their deeds. They can no longer cover up the evil they have done, because they themselves have realized and acknowledged their evil, and indeed Allah is All-Knowing of what they do.
text.29:
Allah swt affirms that what they will receive in the afterlife is none other than Hell Jahannam and the experience of various kinds of torment. They will reside in Hell Jahannam forever and receive torment according to the severity of the sins they committed. This is the fitting punishment and appropriate suffering for those who are arrogant, conceited, and unwilling to follow the guidelines for life and guidance brought by the Messenger.

Allah says:

And those who disbelieve - for them is the fire of Hell. [Death] will not be decreed for them so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one. (Fathir/35: 36)
text.30:
Allah SWT describes the state of the believers when asked about the impact of what Allah has revealed. Those who adhere to the verses of Allah will answer that what was revealed is the goodness and mercy of Allah bestowed upon His servants who obey His religion, believe in His Messenger, and practice the verses in the midst of society. They will become servants of Allah who do good deeds and receive happiness in life, while in the Hereafter they will receive a reward that is even better than the reward they received in the world.

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT affirms that the life of the Hereafter is better and the best place for those who are pious. The happiness they will receive in the Hereafter is eternal, while happiness in the world is only temporary. Happiness in the Hereafter provides satisfaction in the truest sense, while happiness in the world is temporary and limited. The happiness that will be received by the believers is explained in the following verse:

So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the excellent reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves those who do good. (Ali 'Imran/3: 148)
text.31:
Allah swt describes the state of the believers when asked about the impact of what Allah has revealed. Those who adhere to Allah's verses will answer that what has been revealed is the goodness and mercy of Allah bestowed upon His servants who obey His religion and believe in His Messenger, and practice the verses in the midst of society. They will become servants of Allah who do good deeds and receive happiness in life, while in the Hereafter they will receive a reward that is even better than the reward they received in the world.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that the life of the Hereafter is better and the best place for those who are pious. The happiness they will receive in the Hereafter is eternal, while happiness in the world is only temporary. Happiness in the Hereafter provides satisfaction in the truest sense, while happiness in the world is temporary and limited. The happiness that will be received by the believers is explained in the following verse:

So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the excellent reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves those who do good. (Ali 'Imran/3: 148)
text.32:
Allah SWT describes that those who are pious, who always obey all of Allah's commands and avoid all His prohibitions, when the angel of death comes to take their lives, they die in a state of *husnul khatimah* (a good ending) and receive greetings of peace from the angels. This is because they are free from the blemishes of polytheism and disobedience, and their souls remain under the guidance of Allah SWT's revelation. Their entire journey is adorned with noble character and free from despicable traits. Such a person faces his Lord with an open heart and surrenders himself, because he feels that he is leaving the transient world, and going to receive the provisions that have been determined by his Lord. At that time, he faces death calmly and happily. Allah SWT says:

"Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is Allah" and then remained steadfast - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], "Do not fear and do not grieve, but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised." (Fussilat/41: 30)

Then Allah SWT explains that the angels give the good news that they will enter the Paradise that has been prepared for them, according to the good deeds they have done. The good news conveyed by the angels to them is Allah's promise that they will experience later after the Day of Resurrection.

It is narrated from Muhammad bin Ka'ab Al-Quradhi that he said, "When a believing servant's death arrives, the angels come and say, "Peace be upon you, O friend of Allah, Allah sends greetings to you and gives you the good news that you will enter Paradise." (Narrated by Ibn Jarir ath-Thabari and al-Baihaqi)
text.33:
Allah SWT explains that there is no point in giving the polytheists of Mecca the opportunity to change their attitude. They will remain steadfast in their position until the angels seize their souls, or the command of God comes to send down punishment upon them in this world, as experienced by the disbelievers before them.

Among the polytheists who did not obey the prophets and messengers, some were destroyed by thunder, devastated by earthquakes, and others were wiped out by great floods and hurricanes that came unexpectedly. This verse is a stern warning to them, with the intention that they believe in Allah and His Messenger and immediately abandon falsehood and return to the truth before a disaster befalls them, as had befallen those before them.

Then Allah SWT explains that their ancestors, who had the same characteristics and behavior as them, had already experienced destruction because of Allah's punishment for not listening to the call of Allah's messengers and prophets who guided them to the truth. Those who remained wallowing in falsehood were annihilated by Allah with severe torment. This does not mean that Allah has wronged them, but rather they themselves have wronged themselves. Allah has sufficiently provided guidance through revelation and clear evidence of the truth of that revelation. However, they still rebelled and denied the truth and defiled their souls by creating idols as gods to be associated with Allah.
text.34:
They were struck by a terrible disaster because of the evil they committed. None of them could escape that terrible disaster because everything proceeded according to Allah's decree and sunnah. They had been given repeated warnings that Allah's punishment would come at some point. However, instead of accepting it with awareness, they instead denied and mocked the messenger who brought news of the destruction they would experience as a result of their actions.

In the afterlife, they will also feel something even more terrible, which is when they have been decreed to enter the gates of Hell (Jahanam) which they cannot avoid.

Allah SWT says:

"This is the Day of Decision which you used to deny." (as-shaffat/37: 21)
text.35:
Allah SWT then explains the deception of the polytheists and their reasons for rejecting the Messenger of Allah SAW and his followers. They argued that they worshipped idols because Allah had approved of that worship. If Allah had wanted them to worship Allah the One and Only, surely they would not have worshipped anything other than Allah SWT.

Similarly, their determination regarding: *bahirah* (a female camel that has given birth five times and the fifth offspring is male), *sibah* (a female camel that is allowed to go wherever it wants because of a vow), *wasilah* (a female sheep that gives birth to twins, one male and one female), and *ham* (a male camel that cannot be disturbed because it has impregnated a female camel ten times), as animals that are forbidden, according to them, had been approved by Allah.

If Allah did not like what they had done, surely they would have been guided to the right path, or Allah would have inflicted punishment upon them immediately. These are some of the reasons put forward by the polytheists to reject the revelation that had been revealed to the Prophet Muhammad SAW. The reasons they put forward were similar to the actions of those before them in rejecting the messengers.

Allah SWT refutes the reasons they put forward and rejects their false assumptions. Allah does not justify what they do because Allah has conveyed guidance through His Messenger. The Messenger has conveyed guidance to his people to the right path through the mediation of His revelation.

Allah SWT says:

"And We did not send any messenger before you (Muhammad) except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me." (al-Anbiya'/21: 25)

Allah's guidance, conveyed through His Messenger, will be enjoyed by those who truly strive to obtain it.

Allah SWT says:

"And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good." (al-'Ankabut/29: 69)

Therefore, if there are people who do not want to listen to the invitation of the Messenger, it is not the Messenger's duty to force them to accept his da'wah. That is not the duty and responsibility of the Messenger, nor is it the nature of the Islamic religion. Islam does not force those who do not want to accept the truth.
text.36:
Allah swt explains that the messengers were sent according to the *sunnatullah* (divine law) that applied to previous communities. They were guides for humanity to the straight path. The guidance of these messengers was accepted by those whom Allah willed, leading them to worldly prosperity and the happiness of the hereafter.

Allah swt explains that He sent a messenger to every previous community, just as He sent Prophet Muhammad saw to all of humanity. Therefore, people should follow his call and abandon all his prohibitions.

Allah swt says:

"Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner." (Fathir/35: 24)

And His saying:

"And ask, [O Muhammad], those of Our messengers whom We sent before you, "Did We make besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?"" (az-Zukhruf/43: 45)

From the above explanation, it can be understood that Allah does not want His servants to become disbelievers, because Allah swt has forbidden them from denying Him. This prohibition has been conveyed through His messengers. However, considering human nature, it is possible that some among them will deny Allah, because humans have been given intellect and freedom to choose according to their will. Allah's decree (*takdir*) applies according to their choices. Therefore, if some of His servants remain immersed in disbelief and are cast into Hellfire (*Jahannam*), they have no reason to argue. Allah has sufficiently provided intellect and freedom to choose and determine which path they will take. And Allah Himself does not want His servants to become disbelievers.

It is then further explained that Allah has warned His servants who deny the truth of the messengers with the threat of punishment in this world if they do not change their stance and accept the guidance brought by the messengers. Therefore, Allah destroyed them with His severe punishment. But there were also some among them who were given guidance by Allah, so they accepted and followed the guidance and revelation brought by His messenger. These are the people who are fortunate and safe from Allah's torment.

After that, Allah swt commanded them to travel throughout the earth and witness the lands inhabited by the wrongdoers. They were told to see how the lives of those who denied the religion of Allah ended. In this verse, Allah swt commands people to conduct research on the history of other nations and compare between nations that obey Allah and His messenger with those who deny the call of Allah and His messenger. This is none other than because Allah wants them to follow the call of the messenger.
text.37:
Allah SWT then explained to Prophet Muhammad SAW not to be disappointed in the face of his people's denial and excessive disobedience, even though the Messenger himself greatly desired them to become believers. Allah SWT explained to Rasulullah SAW that even though he greatly hoped that his people would receive guidance and follow his call, that hope was useless if Allah did not will them to receive guidance because they had made their own choices. They turned away from the guidance of revelation and were attracted to the deception of Satan, thus falling into the valley of disobedience and polytheism.

Allah SWT says:

"Indeed, you (O Muhammad) guide not whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He knows best those who are guided." (al-Qasas/28: 56)

And His saying:

"And my advice will not benefit you, even if I want to advise you, if Allah intends to leave you astray. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned." (Hud/11: 34)

And the word of Allah:

"And whomever Allah sends astray - there will be for him no guide." (ar-Ra'd/13: 33)

Therefore, Allah will not give them guidance again, because they have chosen error and have been given an explanation of the consequences that will befall them.

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT explains that if He wills to punish them, no one can give them help. Allah is powerful over His creation, and Allah determines the fate of that creation.
text.38:
Allah SWT explains to Prophet Muhammad SAW that they swore by the name of Allah with a serious attitude that they remained adamant in their disbelief in the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection after this worldly life. Their defiance of the Day of Resurrection is a result of their denial of the Messenger's call. They believe that death is nothing more than destruction and annihilation, so how could resurrection occur after the body is destroyed and the bones become decayed? Returning something that has been destroyed to its original form is impossible.

Allah SWT corrects their false belief and affirms that such a belief is not true. The correct belief is that resurrecting all dead people is a promise that Allah has established and will certainly occur. Because most of them do not understand the attributes of Allah who has unlimited power, they do not believe in the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection, where at this time all creatures that have been destroyed will be resurrected from their graves. They will be brought back to life to be held accountable for their deeds in the world.
text.39:
Allah swt explains the wisdom behind the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection, which is to clarify to them the truth of the revelation brought by the messengers whom they denied and disputed. On that day, they will witness the truth of the revelation and realize the error of their opinions regarding the teachings conveyed by the messengers. This is the regret experienced by those who wrong themselves. At that time, they will feel that the call of the messengers was the true guidance of Allah, while they regret their denial with a regret that is no longer useful.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that He resurrects them on the Day of Judgment so that those who deny the truth of His revelation may know that the Day of Resurrection and retribution that they denied truly occurs. They turn out to be liars, and they only lie to themselves. On that day, they will truly witness the punishment of Allah that was threatened to them, and they will no longer be able to escape from that punishment.

Allah swt says:

"(It will be said to them), "This is the Fire which you used to deny." (ath-Thur/52:14)

His saying again:

"Enter therein [to burn]; and whether you are patient or impatient, it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed for what you used to do." (ath-Thur/52:16)
text.40:
Allah SWT explains that His power is limitless and cannot be restricted in the slightest by any creation, whether in the heavens or on the earth. Allah SWT states that if He wills to bring the dead to life, He only needs to say to it, "Be." And it comes into being according to Allah's will.

In another verse, Allah SWT explains that the realization of something He wills does not require a long time, but rather is sufficient in a short time.

Allah SWT says:

"And Our command is but one word, like a glance of the eye." (al-Qamar/54: 50)

Allah also clarifies that resurrecting those who have died is for Him the same as creating a single soul.

Allah SWT says:

"Your creation and your resurrection are only like (the creation and resurrection of) a single soul. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing." (Luqman/31: 28)
text.41:
Allah SWT explains that those who emigrated, leaving behind loved ones and their homelands solely to seek reward and pleasure from Allah, will surely be given a good place in His presence. The emigration referred to in this verse is the emigration of the Muslims from Mecca to Abyssinia (Habasha), the first emigration undertaken by 83 Muslims. This understanding is based on the opinion that this verse is a Makkiyyah verse, and is strengthened by a narration from Abdullah bin Humaid, Ibn Jarir ath-Thabari, and Ibn Munzir from Qatadah, who said that the companions of the Prophet SAW were persecuted by the people of Mecca. They were driven out of their homelands, so some of them joined the emigration to Abyssinia. After that, Allah commanded them to prepare to emigrate to Medina, then that city was made a city of emigration and they were given helpers consisting of the believing people of Medina.

Then they were promised victory over those who had persecuted them and a good place in the world. All of this was obtained because they were willing to leave their homes and possessions, solely to seek the pleasure of Allah. The promise of victory given to the Muslims was that they would be given a place free from the power of the polytheists and they could manage their own social order. They would become pious leaders and rule over pious people as well.

In addition, they are also promised a greater reward in the Hereafter. If they knew, they would certainly say that the reward of the Hereafter is more excellent when compared to the happiness they feel in this world. Ibn Jarir ath-Thabari narrated from Umar bin Khaththab that when an Ansar gave a gift to a man from the Muhajirin, he said, "Accept this gift, may Allah bless you in enjoying it. This is what Allah has promised you in this world, while in the Hereafter you will get something even better."
text.42:
This verse explains the characteristics of a Muslim who is promised by Allah to attain victory in this world and happiness in the hereafter. They are those who are patient with what befalls them, such as enduring the torment of the disbelieving Quraysh, bearing the suffering of longing for their abandoned homeland, and carrying the burden of life in exile due to hardship and being isolated from their families who are still in Mecca.

Allah's word:

"Those who have believed, emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are far greater in rank in the sight of Allah. It is they who are the attainers [of success]." (at-Taubah/9: 20)

At the end of the verse, Allah swt mentions their characteristic as those who are patient and entrust their affairs to Allah. That is, those who surrender the outcome of their struggle to Allah because that struggle is what they undertake to achieve happiness in this world and the hereafter.

The qualities of patience and reliance (tawakal) are among the most important characteristics that those who defend the truth must possess. Because these two qualities are very decisive in whether or not aspirations are achieved.
text.43:
Allah states that He did not send any messenger before Prophet Muhammad except men to whom He gave revelation. This verse illustrates that the messengers who were sent were only men from the descendants of Adam a.s. up to Prophet Muhammad saw, whose duty was to guide their people so that they would adhere to the religion of monotheism and follow the guidance of revelation. Therefore, those who are suitable to be sent to carry out that task are messengers of their own kind and who speak their language. At the time Prophet Muhammad saw was sent, the Arabs denied that Allah could possibly send a messenger who was a human being like them. They wanted the one sent to be an angel, as Allah swt says:

"And they say, "Why does this Messenger eat food and walk in the markets? Why was an angel not sent down to him to be a warner with him?" (al-Furqan/25: 7)

And His saying:

"Is it a wonder to the people that We have revealed to a man from among themselves, "Warn mankind, and give good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their Lord"? The disbelievers say, "Indeed, this is an obvious magician." (Yunus/10: 2)

Regarding the rejection of the Arabs towards the prophethood of Muhammad because he was an ordinary human being, it can be read from a narration of adh-ahhak which is attributed to Ibn 'Abbas that after Muhammad saw was appointed as a messenger, the Arabs who denied his prophethood said, "Allah is too Great for His messenger to be a human being." Then the verses of Surah Yunus above were revealed.

In this verse, Allah swt asks the polytheists to ask the People of the Book, both Jews and Christians, whether in their books there is any information that Allah ever sent angels to them. If it is indeed mentioned in their books that Allah ever sent down angels as messengers of Allah, they may deny the prophethood of Muhammad. However, if it is mentioned in their books that Allah only sent messengers to them who were human beings of the same kind as them, then their attitude of denying the prophethood of Muhammad saw is not correct.
text.44:
After that, Allah SWT explained that the messengers were sent with clear proofs of their truthfulness. What is meant by clear proofs in this verse are the miracles that prove the truth of their prophethood. Meanwhile, what is meant by *az-zubur* are the books containing guidance for life and legal systems given by Allah to mankind.

This verse also explains that Allah revealed the Al-Qur'an to Prophet Muhammad SAW so that he could explain to mankind the teachings, commands, prohibitions, and rules of life that they must pay attention to and practice. The Al-Qur'an also contains stories of past peoples to be used as examples in navigating life in the world. Prophet Muhammad was also commanded to explain the laws contained in the Al-Qur'an and to detail the verses that are general, specify the general, limit the absolute, and so on, so that they are easily understood and in accordance with their thinking abilities.

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT affirms that they should think about the contents of the Al-Qur'an with clear thinking in order to obtain prosperity in life in the world and happiness in the hereafter, free from various kinds of torment and disasters such as those that befell previous peoples.
text.45:
Allah warns the polytheists, who are constantly trying to devise evil plans and schemes and obstruct the propagation of Islam, that they will never feel safe from the threats of Allah that will be inflicted upon them. These threats are:

First: Allah will sink them into the earth and destroy them from this world, as experienced by Qarun.

Second: Allah will send down punishment upon them from the sky at a time they do not expect, as experienced by the people of Prophet Lut.

Third: They will be afflicted with torment while they are traveling in search of sustenance or busy trading, so that they have no opportunity to repel it. That is, they will not be able to flee to protect their merchandise and their lives, because the torment will strike suddenly.

Fourth: They will experience torment as punishment after suffering losses of property and lives, so that they cannot escape from that torment.

Then Allah SWT concludes His word by stating that Allah is Most Compassionate and Most Merciful. This is to show that Allah will not punish them immediately, but threatens them with severe torment. This is to give them time to think and time to change their attitude towards the invitation of the Messenger. This is proof of Allah's vast mercy for His servants.
text.46:
Allah warns the polytheists, who are constantly trying to devise evil plans and schemes and obstruct the propagation of Islam, that they will never feel safe from the threats of Allah that will be inflicted upon them. These threats are:

First: Allah will sink them into the earth and annihilate them from this world, as was experienced by Qarun.

Second: Allah will send down punishment upon them from the sky at a time they do not expect, as was experienced by the people of Prophet Lut.

Third: They will be afflicted with torment while they are traveling in search of sustenance or busy trading, so that they have no opportunity to repel it. This means they will not be able to flee to protect their merchandise and their lives, because the torment will strike suddenly.

Fourth: They will experience torment as punishment after suffering losses of property and lives, so that they cannot escape from that torment.

Then Allah SWT concludes His words by stating that Allah is Most Compassionate and Most Merciful. This is to show that Allah will not punish them immediately, but threatens them with severe torment. This is to give them an opportunity to think and time to change their attitude towards the invitation of the Messenger. This is evidence of Allah's vast mercy for His servants.
text.47:
Allah warns the polytheists, who are always trying to make evil plans and schemes and obstruct the propagation of Islam, that they will never feel safe from the threats of Allah that will be inflicted upon them. These threats are:

First: Allah will sink them from the surface of the earth and destroy them from this universe, as experienced by Qarun.

Second: Allah will send down punishment upon them from the sky at a time they do not expect, as experienced by the people of Prophet Lut.

Third: They will be afflicted with torment while traveling in search of sustenance or busy trading, so that they will have no opportunity to reject it. That is, they will not be able to flee to protect their merchandise and their lives, because the torment will strike suddenly.

Fourth: They will experience punishment as a penalty after suffering losses of property and life, so that they cannot escape from that punishment.

Then Allah SWT concludes His word by stating that Allah is Most Compassionate and Most Merciful. This is to show that Allah will not punish them immediately, but threatens them with severe punishment. This is to give them time to think and time to change their attitude towards the invitation of the Messenger. This is proof of Allah's vast mercy for His servants.
text.48:
Then Allah swt mentions the signs of His power that apply to all of His creation, with the intention that those who are always plotting evil schemes should contemplate everything that Allah swt has created, for example, shadows. When the sun rises in the eastern horizon, the shadows of all objects stretch westward. Then, as the sun rises higher, the shadows shrink, and finally, when the sun crosses the meridian, the shadow changes direction. When the sun begins to descend, the shadow gradually lengthens eastward, until the sun approaches the horizon in the western part, and the shadow has stretched eastward. The shadows change in this way because they are subject to the laws that Allah has established.

The shadow not only changes direction to the west and east, but also to the north and south every year. When the sun is exactly at the equator on the meridian, there is no shadow at all. However, for the following days, after March 21, when the sun is at the meridian, the sun casts a shadow that points south. Then, on June 21, at the same time, when the sun is at the meridian, the shadows of every object point south at their longest. Afterwards, it gets shorter and shorter until September 23. Since then, the sun has begun to move south and the shadows begin to point north, getting longer and longer until December 22, when the sun casts shadows pointing north at their longest. Then, on the following day, the sun begins to move north, and the shadows begin to shorten day by day. Finally, on March 21, the sun returns to the equator, so that when the sun reaches the meridian, the shadow is not visible at all. And so on. This happens because the annual movement of the sun is subject to the laws created by Allah and applies to all of His creation.

Allah's explanation like this is directed to humans so that they are willing to research and come to the conclusion that all objects in this universe do not oppose Allah's laws but are subject to His power.
